main event: A military observation reported an ECHO II satellite sighting on 17 November 1964.
interesting points: The ECHO II was observed heading 315 at 60 degrees E and 37 degrees E at the reported time., The sighting was evaluated as a celestial object moving at a speed of 40 degrees per 25 seconds., Observation was conducted visually from the ground., The report concludes that the object was identified as a satellite., No photographs or physical evidence were recorded in the report.
